original_text:
**INSTITUTION
CRITICAL CARE MEDICINE
ATTENDING PHYSICIAN PROGRESS NOTE
PATIENT NAME :
**NAME[AAA , BBB M]
ACCOUNT # :
**ID-NUM
**ROOM
ATTENDING PHYSICIAN :
**NAME[YYY M ZZZ]
ADMISSION DATE :
**DATE[Nov 19 2007]
EVALUATION DATE :
**DATE[Dec 25 07]
I am managing this critically ill **AGE[in 40s]- year - old male status post laparotomy and debridement in the setting of pancreatitis .
His hospital course has been complicated by respiratory failure , ARDS. I am seeing this patient for the management of respiratory failure and multiple medical issues .
I have seen and examined this patient , reviewed his laboratory , radiographic , and Emtek data and discussed the management with his surgical team .
PROBLEMS AND MANAGEMENT ARE AS FOLLOWS :
1. Respiratory failure :
The patient 's chest x-ray has an ongoing stable bilateral infiltrates .
I am maintaining the patient on BIPAP gently 12/8 and with a goal of oxygen saturation in the range of 90 to 95% .
The patient today could not tolerate any time off BIPAP .
One of the approaches I will take today is I will diureses him with Lasix drip for a goal of ( - ) 1 liter and this may help his time off the BIPAP machine .
2. Hypertension :
The patient 's blood pressure seem to be improving gradually with multiple medications trying to manage his blood pressure .
He is currently on Captopril , clonidine , and Lopressor for his hypertension .
3. ICU prophylaxis :
The patient is currently on heparin infusion for his SMA repair , and he is also on peptic ulcer disease prophylaxis with Famotidine .
__________________________________
**NAME[M. WWW XXX] , M.D.
Dictator :
**NAME[M. WWW XXX] , M.D.
